intro: Erysimum banaticum, commonly known as the Banat mustard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed and alternate upper leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, and it produces small, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Erysimum banaticum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
